title: Diameter of Binary Tree
statement: Given a binary tree, find its diameter. The diameter is the length of the longest path between any two nodes in a tree. This path may or may not pass through the root. Length is number of edges.
input_format:
First line contains N (number of nodes including nulls in level order).
Second line contains N space-separated integers (-1 for null).
output_format: Print the diameter (number of edges on longest path).
